meanings.definition: In a way that causes trouble or difficulty
meanings.sent1: She arrived inconveniently late to the meeting, causing everyone to wait.
meanings.sent2: He inconveniently forgot his keys at home and had to go back to get them.
meanings.sent3: The cat inconveniently knocked over the vase, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The rain inconveniently poured down just as we were about to leave for the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The power outage inconveniently occurred during the important presentation.

meanings.definition: In a way that is not convenient or suitable
meanings.sent1: The store inconveniently closed early on the day I needed to buy groceries.
meanings.sent2: She inconveniently chose the busiest time to call, interrupting my work.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock inconveniently did not go off, making him late for work.
meanings.sent4: The printer inconveniently ran out of ink right before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The road construction inconveniently caused a traffic jam during rush hour.
